cells.data:
Proofs (cont.)

Iff ($\iff$) proofs: $p \iff q$
Need 2 proofs, since it is logically equivalent to $p \implies q \land q \implies p$

What about $p_1 \iff p_2 \iff p_3$?
This is the statement that all three $p_i$ have the same truth value
Split it apart: $(p_1 \implies p_2) \land (p_2 \implies p_3) \land (p_3 \implies p_1)$

How to show something is $F$
Show it's negation is true

$\forall n : P(n)$, use counterexample

1.8 Proof Methods and Strategy

Proof by exhaustion
Case-by-case
w/o Loss of Generality (wlog)
Existence Proof (Constructive or Non-constructive)
Uniqueness
$\exists! x : P(x) \equiv \exists x : (P(x)  \land \forall y : y \neq x \implies \neg P(y))$
